Income Received Before the Effective Date of the Award
Do
not
count income received before the effective date of an original or new award.  (For Survivors Pension cases, do not count income received between the effective date and the date of the Veteran’s death.)  The effective date is the date a claimant is entitled to benefits without regard to
38 CFR 3.31
.
However, if the claimant would have been entitled to current-law pension but current-law pension is not paid solely because income exceeds the MAPR, apply the normal income-counting procedures to any income received or expenses paid after the date that would have been the effective date, had income not exceeded the MAPR.
